fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Sprint filter in Issue Navigator doesn't refresh after clearing search entry. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Version: {{7.0.0-OD-08-005}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator. Make sure *Basic* mode is enabled.
# Click *More* and tick *Sprint*.
# Once the *Sprint* filter appears, click the drop-down arrow
# Search for an existing sprint and tick a result
# Clear search query by clicking (x)
# Start typing another sprint name. This should refresh the suggested sprints, but it doesn't.

h3. Expected Results
When the search query is cleared, the suggested sprints should be updated and displayed.

h3. Actual Results
When the search query is cleared, the suggested sprints should is not updated and the same sprints listed previously is displayed.
 
h3.Workaround
After ticking a sprint, click away from the drop-down and open the drop-down again. It should now be refreshed with suggestions.
fields.summary: Sprint filter in Issue Navigator doesn't refresh after clearing search query

2. Make sure you are in list view in the issue navigator and that the sidebar is visible
3. Click an issue
4. Click return to search

Expected:

Actual:

Tested on v6.5-m05#65001-sha1:a20d53b:node2

fields.description:
After the update to JIRA 7, when creating a project, the 'Software Development' project type is not longer an option. It was an option on JIRA Cloud 6.

JIRA Agile now has a similar issue type, 'Basic software development', but the workflow is not the same and the previous one did not require JIRA Agile

*Workaround*

If before the update you had a project using this project type, you can select the same workflow by:
# Copying the workflow
# Setting it in your project
fields.summary: 'Software Development' project type missing after update to JIRA 7 in Cloud instances
CSV Import with date field fails to import when dates are within the last 2 days
CSV import link to "check created issues" does not escape invalid project keys in JQL

fields.description:
The JIRA Issues Calendar gadget has a link that used to display all issues for that given day on the Issue Navigator (a filter according to the option selected in the "Date to Display" field in the gadget's configuration). However, after this week's upgrade, the link opens the Issue Navigator showing all the issues (JQL filtering for nothing) or the last known search.
This isn't happening in the previous version (hash 075c9028e496abd6af91607eb0e883bd0a62f618).

Steps to reproduce:
# Add the JIRA Issues Calendar gadget to a dashboard
# Filter it to a project
# Select a Date to Display (Created, Updated, Due Date) and save the gadget
# Click the number (which is a link) on a given day

No workaround yet to display all issues, but you can click individually on each issue's "square" to open it.

h3. {color:red}*Reopening information*{color}
This is happening again for the 4.0.0-D20150902T050440 version of the JIRA Calendar plugin in JIRA 7.0.0-OD-04.
fields.summary: Link to view issues in JIRA Issues Calendar gadget not working

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
- Have Confluence, JIRA and Bonfire running as example
- Add Activity Stream Gadget on your dashboard

||Test||Expected Results||Actual Results||
|Edit the gadget and select Bonfire and Confluence|JIRA, Confluence and Bonfire data will show up.|JIRA, Confluence and Bonfire data shows up. (/)|
|Edit the gadget and select only Bonfire|Only Bonfire and JIRA data will show up.|Only Bonfire data shows up. (x)|
|Edit the gadget and select only Confluence|Only JIRA and Confluence data will show up.|Only Confluence data will show up. (x)|
|Edit the gadget and uncheck all checkboxes|Only JIRA data will show up.|"No activity was found" message shows up. (x)|

*Notes:*
I believe this behaviour is associated with bug JRA-43069, where JIRA option is not showing up, and therefore the add-on doesn't know if it has to bring JIRA data as well with the selected options. Though, more investigation is necessary.
fields.summary: Activity Stream not working properly

fields.description:
Hello,
I have a created vs. resolved gadget on my dashboard and I've noticed that the number of resolved issues is incorrect in the chart.

Here are the steps to reproduce:
1. create a dashboard
2. add the created vs resolved gadget to the dashboard (can be for all issues in a project or using a filter - doesn't matter); and can be for any number of days
3. take note of the number of resolved issues
4. now run a manual query and compare the number of issues that are displayed (so for example if your chart is pulling the data for the last 30 days >> project = ZZZ AND resolutiondate >= -30d)

Result: the number of resolved issues shown in the chart does not match the number of resolved issues in the search view

Expected result: matching numbers
fields.summary: created vs. resolved gadget shows incorrect resolved total

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring the Incoming Email setting SECURE_IMAP if left the POP / IMAP Port blanck it will automatically set the port 25 when should set 993. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Incoming MAil;
# Click on edit;
# Configure as SECURE_IMAP;
# Left the port empty;
# Click on Update.

h3. Expected Results
Set the port 993.

h3. Actual Results
Is setting the port 25.

h3.Workaround
Set the port 993 manually.
fields.summary: Incorrect default port for SECURE_IMAP

fields.description:
*Summary*

If a workflow is set up with a post function that automatically maps the assignee to a role or another field using [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions] an error is currently being thrown when transitioning the issue.

*Steps to replicate*

# Set up a workflow with a post-function that sets the assignee to the contents of another field, such as reporter.
# Transition an issue so that post-function occurs

*Expected Result*

Assignee changes

*Actual Result*

Error is thrown in the transition 'unable to copy value from reporter to assignee'

When editing the post-function the following value is shown:

{noformat}
$textutils.htmlEncode(${fieldValue})
{noformat}

*Workaround*

A workaround for now is to remove the post-function that automatically assigns issues and manually assign issues instead. If you do not want to trust all users to assign issues then your best bet is to restrict assign issue permission.

If the 'create issue originally' post function exists (in case it's the 'create' transition, moving the auto-assigning post function up, before the 'create' one has worked in some cases as a workaround.
fields.summary: Auto-assigning issues in JIRA Cloud transition throwing errors

fields.description:
I am experiencing an issue with the recent changes to JIRA behaviour in regards to having linked parent and sub-task items. The specific workflow I have previously used is as follows.

h3. Workflow
- I have a "stories" workflow which contains "Selected for Development", "In Progress", "Awaiting test", "Done" states and global transitions.
- I have a "tasks" workflow which contains "Selected for Development", "In progress", "Awaiting test", "Ready for Release" states.
- The "tasks" workflow has post functions in it's transitions to push through stories to "In progress" as soon as any sub-task of that story is "In Progress" or "Awaiting test". Likewise for pushing stories back in to "In progress" upon test failures, etc. These post function transition changes are using the names for the global transitions in the "stories" workflow.
- The "stories" workflow has sub-task blocking conditions on it's global transitions to prevent the story transitioning to an invalid state if further sub tasks are created (e.g. the story can't go from "In progress" to "Awaiting test" until all of it's sub-tasks are "Ready for release").

h3. Result
This results in failed transactions in the situation where the parent "story" item has a sub-task blocking condition that means the story can't be transitioned to the requested state. This in turn causes the entire transaction to roll back for the sub-task. 

I had previously fixed this using Groovy expressions to determine when the parent story was in the correct state, and only trigger the transition under these circumstances. Since Groovy expression support has now also been disabled for JIRA cloud, there is no way to achieve this behaviour any more. 

This in turn is going to lead to more team overhead in having to keep track of stories and what state their sub-tasks are in.

I am raising this new issue off the back of discussions with Innovalog in this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44681

Innovalog are updating JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions to warn instead of error when an invalid parent state is specified (taken from linked issue):

h3. Workaround provided by David from Innovalog
Use transition Names instead of Transition IDs when specifying the Transition to execute on the Parent (or Linked) Issue. When you use transition names, if the specified transition is not applicable for the current status of the parent (or linked) issue, a WARN will be logged but the current transition (on the subtask) will complete successfully.
A fix will be applied shortly to JMWE to provide the same behavior when specifying transition IDs.

Whilst I understand that the new JIRA behaviour is probably more correct, and that transactions should be fully atomic and roll back, as they now do, this behaviour is undesirable in the workflow scenario I describe above. The approach that seemed most correct was to only trigger a parent transition if the parent's sub tasks were in a set of "correct" states, as per the Groovy expression behaviour I initially implemented as a workaround for this change. 

Since this is now not possible, I can't see another way to make the above approach work.
fields.summary: "Commit failed, rollback previously requested by nested transaction" error in JIRA 7 when parent condition blocks child transition

2015-03-31 16:16:41.834520500 2015-03-31 16:16:41,831 TP-Processor20 ERROR sysadmin 976x8399x3 1hf9b77 111.221.53.138,131.103.29.194 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json [web.rapid.work.WorkResource] Unable to complete GreenHopper REST method

2015-03-31 16:16:41.834523500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.DocumentIssueImpl.getDueDate(DocumentIssueImpl.java:291)

I have added JIRA Cloud as a search provider in firefox and configured it with the keyword "jira". This allows me to type e.g. "jira EV-133" in the location bar in the browser to open issue EV-133. It does not work reliably, though. If I haven't been accessing our jira for some time, say a day maybe, then the search doesn't work - instead I end up on the dashboard page instead of the EV-133 ticket. If I type the same search again "jira EV-133" it always works the next time. It seems like something sort of "times out" after a while causing the redirection to the frontpage/dashboard, but I am still signed in and do not need to enter my credentials again.

Steps to reproduce.
1. Open firefox, navigate to JIRA cloud instance
2. Click on the "loupe with the small green plus" in the search field in the browser gui to the right of the location bar, then click on "Add Issues Navigator - Atlassian JIRA..."
3. After adding it click on the loupe icon again and select "Change search settings"
4. Double click in the keyword column in the row with atlassian JIRA search and enter the keyword "jira"
5. Search for some issue, lets say EV-133 by typing "jira EV-133" in the location bar
6. Wait for a long while, perhaps a few days and search for "jira EV-133"

Expected behavior:
...
6. Issue EV-133 is shown

Actual behavior:
...
6. The jira dashboard is shown
fields.summary: OpenSearch doesn't work reliably

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start up a fresh JIRA 7.0.0-OD-1 or -2 instance.
# Create a test user and add it to the "jira-users" and "jira-developers" groups.
# Create a project using the default "JIRA Classic" shared workflow/schemes.
# Edit the Open step in the workflow and add the property {{jira.permission.assignable.projectrole}} with a value of {{10002}} (this corresponds to the default "Administrators" role).
# Create a new issue.
# Click Resolve, and in the Resolve Issue screen start typing the username of the test user.

h3. Expected Results
The test user should show up as a valid user to be assigned to in the Assignee dropdown.

h3. Actual Results
The test user doesn't show up at all in the Assignee dropdown.
 
h3. Notes
This used to work under JIRA 6.5-OD-8 and earlier, it appears to be a regression in 7.0.0-OD-1+. These messages show in the JIRA logs when the test user's name is typed in the Assignee field:

{code:none}
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] 	ASSIGNABLE_USER not granted by workflow perm granting ASSIGNABLE_USER to Project Role '10002'
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ASSIGNABLE_USER granted by permission scheme but DENIED by workflow
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] 	ASSIGNABLE_USER not granted by workflow perm granting ASSIGNABLE_USER to Project Role '10002'
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ASSIGNABLE_USER granted by permission scheme but DENIED by workflow
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] 	ASSIGNABLE_USER not granted by workflow perm granting ASSIGNABLE_USER to Project Role '10002'
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ASSIGNABLE_USER granted by permission scheme but DENIED by workflow
{code}

The Permission Helper doesn't report any problems and says that the test user should be able to be assigned issues.

h3.Workaround
Manually type the user's username and click "Resolve". Even though it doesn't show up in the Assignee field, the user can still be assigned to the issue.
fields.summary: jira.permission.assignable.projectrole property set on a workflow step can cause legitimate assignable users to be hidden in Assignee dropdown

fields.description: A new "feature" seems to have been pushed to JIRA on demand that is making assumptions about entered text.  For instance, when I put an asterisk \(*\) on a new line and then enter text, the next line starts with an asterisk.  Text fields should not assume what we're trying to type.  This also really screws up copying/pasting from outside sources.  Please either explain how to disable this (can't find docs) or disable it until you have a way of allowing us to change this.  If this can't or won't be changed, we'll be moving to a new bug tracking system.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Admin migrated a Cloud instance of JIRA/Confluence to a new base URL. During the migration to the new JIRA/Confluence instance, inactive users became active. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in JIRA Cloud
# Deactive user. Make inactive.
# Follow the steps under "JIRA + Confluence Instances" in this URL:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Changing+the+Cloud+Instance+URL+Address+or+Migrating+to+a+New+Cloud+Instance
# Log into the new instance. Users that were once inactive are now active

h3. Expected Results
For users to migrate over to the new Cloud instance with the correct status.

h3. Actual Results
Users are flipped from inactive to active.
 
h3.Workaround
To deactivate users via the User Management tab in the new Cloud Instance.
fields.summary: Migrating JIRA/Confluence from Cloud to Cloud reactivates inactive users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a CSV import to update a moved issue, it incorrectly moves the issue back to the previous project and viewing the issue is no longer possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Import or create an issue, for example MWK-1.
# Move issue to another project, in this example it becomes TECH-2. This can also involve changing things such as version and component, which are project-specific.
# CSV import the issue using the old key MWK-1.

h3. Expected Results

The TECH-2 issue is updated, using the data from MWK-1 (it will correctly find the issue using the {{moved_issue_key}} table).

h3. Actual Results

The issue key is moved back to the old project - for example TECH-2 is moved into the MWK project, and keeps the correct issuenum (3). Additionally, the below exception is thrown when attempting to view MWK-1, and TECH-2 will 404.

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Passed List had more than one value.
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityUtil.getOnly(EntityUtil.java:62) [entityengine-1.2.3.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.getIssueFromIssueEntityByProjectAndNumber(DefaultIssueManager.java:986) [DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.getIssueFromIssueEntity(DefaultIssueManager.java:982) [DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.getIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:959) [DefaultIssueManager$IssueFinder.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.getIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:140) [DefaultIssueManager.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.getIssueObject(DefaultIssueManager.java:340) [DefaultIssueManager.class:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.getIssue(DefaultIssueService.java:170) [DefaultIssueService.class:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483) [?:1.8.0_20]
{noformat}

See [^full_stack_trace] for more info.

h3. Notes

Looking into the database we can see the problem is the project key is changed back to what it was. Prior to the import:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

And after:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | test    |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

The {{moved_issue_key}} table is not updated:

{noformat}
select * from moved_issue_key ;
  id   | old_issue_key | issue_id
-------+---------------+----------
 10000 | MWK-1         |    10001
(1 row)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The issue cannot be accessed to be moved, unless through bulk edit. Then when moving the issue back to TECH, it will create a new issue key (such as TECH-3). MWK-1 will then not redirect to TECH-3 and anything linked to TECH-2 will break. As such a SQL update is needed. For example:

# Stop JIRA.
# Identify the appropriate project:
{noformat}
select id from project where pkey = 'TECH';
  id
-------
 10001
(1 row)
{noformat}
# Update the issue to have the correct project:
{noformat}
update jiraissue set project = 10001 where id = 10001;
UPDATE 1
{noformat}
# Start JIRA and reindex.

This will allow updating with CSV, however any affected issue keys will need to be restored after the import. The alternative is to not map the issue key field however then new issues will be created instead of updating old ones.

h3. Original Description

{quote}
I saw this in the online version
Steps to reproduce
# Import an issue 
(ABC-154)
# Move issue to another project (changing version and component)
(XYZ-232)
# Import issue comments using old key.
# Comments import successfully

Problems:
* Moves issue back to old project (but retains new issue number). 
(ABC-232)
* Second key does not redirect
(XYZ-232 is not found)
First key does still re-direct
* The project specific field values are not changed (component and version refer to wrong project).

Workaround: Move the project back to the new project (XYZ-457)

This was very confusing and I'm not sure what problems it would have caused (mostly regarding the mismatched fields) if I had not found it when doing verification. It seems like a bad state for the issue to be in.
{quote}
fields.summary: Import changes project, but not issue number

fields.description:
The JIRA Health Check plugin's {{LuceneHealthCheck}} runs a search from a non-request thread.  This leaks a reference to a {{DelayedCloseSearcher}} in a {{ThreadLocal}} variable, meaning that it will keep open references to that searcher for longer than needed.

These search services were never really designed to be used this way and the only way to prevent the leak is to call jira-core's {{DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers()}} or to use jira-api's {{JiraThreadLocalUtil}} component, which eventually gets there.  Note that the fact that an old searcher is held in the cache also means that it probably sees old state when running the health check, which is also undesirable.

*Workaround*

Disable the luceneHealthCheck module of the 'Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Healthcheck Plugin'.
fields.summary: JIRA health check leaks a Lucene index

fields.description:
As well as the auto-complete in the "Quick Find" field for gadgets (Pie Chart, Filter Results, etc.), the old-style gadgets had an Advanced Search link that would pop up a window with more useful search options. The inline gadgets are missing that, and as a result of JRA-32218 this means that filters with certain names are _impossible_ to select for use in the gadget.

[~ohernandez@atlassian.com] suggested a short-term workaround to be adding the Advanced Search option back into inline gadgets.
fields.summary: Inline gadgets are missing the "Advanced Search" link for filter/project searching

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Create a two-dimensional filter gadget on a dashboard
# Populate it with a query that will load many items
# Click Show More

Expected Results:

Gadget expands with more results

Actual Results:

Gadget does not expand

Workaround:

In the Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin add-on disable the module 'two-dimensional-stats-dashboard-item'
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter gadget doesn't load when clicking 'show more'

fields.summary: JIRA Mobile (cloud) returns HTTP 500

fields.description:
If you go to the application links page, it has no sidebar, but it should have one.

jira.example.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks

Probably this affects versions before 6.5, but I didn't verify.
fields.summary: Applinks page has no sidebar

fields.description:
STR:
- Go to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=37412#
- Click on Details > New subscription (attachment)
=> It leads to 404 page (https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/FilterSubscription!default.jspa?filterId=37412&returnUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fecosystem.atlassian.net%2Fissues%2F%3Ffilter%3D37412%23)
fields.summary: Add new filter subscription leads to 404 page

fields.description: It appears that the refresh intervals and ability to do a manual refresh for the JIRA Filter gadget have been removed.  The only option for refresh is a check box for every 15m.
fields.summary: Refresh Intervals and Manual Refresh no longer available in JIRA Filter Gadget

fields.summary: Calendar Plugin throws a NullPointerException when responding to an anonymous request

fields.description:
When the new project navigation is enabled, we have a problem where the page listing the issues is empty. This is happening on Cloud instances.

This problem is happening to projects with keys that are JQL reserved words. This has been seen with "DO", "AND", "AS" and "IN". Not tested with others. This is what the page shows:

!blank_page.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have Project Navigation enabled
# Create a project where the key is a JQL reserved word, say 'AND'.
# Create an issue in this project
# Select in 'Issues', 'All Issues'
# Go to https://instance/projects/AND/issues
#* Replace AND by the key

*Expected behavior*
* All issues are shown

*Actual outcome*
* No issue is shown, neither the 'No issues were found to match your search'

*Workaround*
* Edit/Change the project key. Steps: visit the project > administration > edit project > edit key
OR
* Use the issue search page: Issues > Search for issues > {{project = 'AND'}}
fields.summary: Projects with JQL reserved words as project keys show blank page with Project Navigation enabled

fields.description: As seen on the attached image, the sub-task menu can display more actions than it fits on the screen.
fields.summary: Sub-task menu overflows the screen and makes some actions impossible to click

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1)Log in into JIRA instance
2)Click the sign "?" for help and choose Shortcuts
3)Notice that W key is used as shortcut to log work in any issue
3)Navigate to any issue 
4)Press W to access the shortcut

*Expected Results:*
When the shortcut W is pressed a popup should appear to allow user to log wor as described on help section.

*Actual Results:*
When W key gets a hit while viewing an issue nothing happens

*Workaround:*
Manually go to More > Log Work within the issue menu.
fields.summary: The Log Work shortcut W is not working

fields.description:
*Description*
If the user creating the project doesn't have all required permissions, and in this particular case of creating a project with an Agile board it includes the permission to "Create Shared Objects", the screen that appears to create the project hangs out and do not complete the task of creating the project.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user that doesn't have the "Create Shared Objects" Global Permission but has administrator permission.
# Try creating a project on JIRA of type "Agile Software Development - ******".
# Fill in the required information and click *Submit*.

*Expected Behaviour*
The project should not be created and JIRA would show a warning message stating the inability of the user to create an Agile board.

*Actual result*
The screen keeps spinning and the operation never completes.
The project is created but the board not.
No warning message or anything else is shown on the screen.
fields.summary: Creation of projects of type "Agile Software Development - ******" cause the process to hang out

fields.description:
h3.Summary
As described in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-DOES_NOT_CONTAIN

When Using the JQL:
{code}
comment !~ "Text"
{code}

If an issues has more than one (>1) comment the "DOES NOT CONTAIN: !~" JQL is ignored an results that contain the "Text" show up in search result


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a single comment to an issue
# use the "DOES NOT CONTAIN: !~" JQL to search for something in the comment
# The result is excluded
# Add a second comment to the issue
# re-run the same JQL

h3. Expected Results
Result Remains Excluded for result set

h3. Actual Results
The Issue is returned in the result set
fields.summary: Comment "DOES NOT CONTAIN: !~" JQL fails with multiple comments

Thanks in advance!

Julio Indriago

When importing CSV files, even though JIM seems to use the date format provided by the user to all the other fields, the 'Date of First Response' still uses the default format.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce

# Go to Application Navigator.
# Add a new entry. In the "Groups" field, search for a group.

h4. Expected results

JIRA returns matching group name, without any error.

h4. Actual results

JIRA returns matching group name, however, throws an error message on the page:
{quote}
*Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved.*
Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, please contact your System Administrator.
{quote}

h4. Other info

* This happens across Safari, Chrome, Firefox. Not tested on IE.
* No error recorded in JIRA logs.
* No error recorded in browser error console.

h4. Workaround

The feature still allows admins to proceed with the link creation (press "Add" and the link will be created).
fields.summary: Application Navigator throws "Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved." when searching for groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

When importing the latest Cloud instance backup into a Standalone instance, the option to configure the 'mode' of the instance (Public or Private) is missing.

h3. Diagnostic

Checking on the entities.xml file, there is a feature flag which has caused this behavior. Use the command below on Unix backend to check on the said entities:
{noformat}
# zgrep "featureName=\"unified.usermanagement\"" JIRA-backup-20150414.zip
    <Feature id="10100" featureName="unified.usermanagement" featureType="site"/>
{noformat}

This feature flag is exclusive to the JIRA Cloud instances and on the JIRA Cloud instances, the mode configuration is delegated to the user management instead.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Obtain a backup from a Cloud instance (which have the dark feature added *unified.usermanagement*)
# Restore it in latest JIRA (6.3.15)
# Head over to the General Configurations and you will noticed that the mode is not visible as below:
!mode.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Remove the feature flag from the database
{noformat}
delete from feature where feature_name like 'unified.usermanagement ';
{noformat}

Alternatively, navigate to the dark feature page:

<instance url>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa

And remove the flag from there.

h3. Proposed Fix

* To remove the feature flag when performing export in JIRA Cloud
OR
* To remove the feature flag during import in JIRA Server
fields.summary: When importing the latest Cloud backup to Standalone, it is not possible to configure the mode of the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflows importing from Trello are causing severe problems in JIRA related to workflows:
# The statuses page gives a 500 error page and a stacktrace. The user is unable to change/view statuses
# No workflow is shown in the workflow page
# Navigation to a project's workflow page is showing this error:
{noformat}
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{noformat}

Stacktrace in the statuses page:
{noformat}
Technical details
Cause
Referer URL: https://agilys.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In 'foreach' command {foreach $status in $statuses}{call .statusRow}{param status: $status /}{param first: isFirst($status) /}{param last: isLast($status) /}{/call}{/foreach}, the data reference does not resolve to a SoyList (encountered type com.google.template.soy.data.restricted.UndefinedData).
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In 'foreach' command {foreach $status in $statuses}{call .statusRow}{param status: $status /}{param first: isFirst($status) /}{param last: isLast($status) /}{/call}{/foreach}, the data reference does not resolve to a SoyList (encountered type com.google.template.soy.data.restricted.UndefinedData).
	at JIRA.Templates.Statuses.success(Unknown Source) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMainHelper(BaseTofu.java:369) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMain(BaseTofu.java:322) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.access$100(BaseTofu.java:66) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu$RendererImpl.render(BaseTofu.java:476) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyManager.render(DefaultSoyManager.java:151) [?:?]
...
	at org.apache.coyote.ajp.AbstractAjpProcessor.process(AbstractAjpProcessor.java:831) [tomcat-coyote.jar:8.0.20]
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$AbstractConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:659) [tomcat-coyote.jar:8.0.20]
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1558) [tomcat-coyote.jar:8.0.20]
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.run(NioEndpoint.java:1515) [tomcat-coyote.jar:8.0.20]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61) [tomcat-util.jar:8.0.20]
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.8.0_45]
Caused by: com.google.template.soy.sharedpasses.render.RenderException: In 'foreach' command {foreach $status in $statuses}{call .statusRow}{param status: $status /}{param first: isFirst($status) /}{param last: isLast($status) /}{/call}{/foreach}, the data reference does not resolve to a SoyList (encountered type com.google.template.soy.data.restricted.UndefinedData).
	at JIRA.Templates.Statuses.success(Unknown Source) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.sharedpasses.render.RenderVisitor.visitForeachNode(RenderVisitor.java:384) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.soytree.AbstractSoyNodeVisitor.visit(AbstractSoyNodeVisitor.java:104) [?:?]
	at com.google.template.soy.soytree.AbstractSoyNodeVisitor.visit(AbstractSoyNodeVisitor.java:56) [?:?]
{noformat}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Carry out an import from Trello with workflows (all conditions here are still unknown)

h3. Expected Results
The workflows are correctly imported

h3. Actual Results
The imported workflows break many pages.
 
h3. Notes
Based on the errors and other issues we think the problem with the workflows is that they use 'action IDs' (the transition IDs) that were already used in different workflows.

This cannot be correctly interpreted by JIRA and the pages break.

h3.Workaround
Contact Support for a fix
fields.summary: Import from Trello is bringing invalid workflow causing errors in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Click Create Issue.
# Choose "Configure Fields", select "Where is my field?".
# Select a field.

h3. Result
You'll immediately get a "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."

The Javascript console reports this:

bq. \[Error] Failed to load resource: https://<instance>/rest/whereismycf/1.0/fields/creator the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)

The content of that request:

{code}
Either 'issueKey', or 'projectKey' or 'projectId' parameter must be provided in the request
{code}

This appears to only happen in the Create Issue screen, it works fine when viewing an already-existing issue.
fields.summary: "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response" when using "Where is my field?" helper on Create Issue screen

fields.description:
Using the new project navigation having JIRA language set to French causes the JIRA Releases panel to show a broken layout where some parts of the page are shown out of the screen boundaries.
!Release_panel.png|thumbnail!

The same behaviour does not happen if you select other languages.

The user can still view all the content on the Release page if he scrolls to the right side.
fields.summary: JIRA Release version panel has a broken layout whenever displaying "Advertisements" tab in French

fields.description:
Since the JIRA Cloud upgrade on November 2nd  (JIRA 6.4-OD-09) the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Widget lo longer displays the Filter name on it's header. 

This can cause problems to users who use multiple instances of this widget on the same dashboard, since there's no visible way to see which filter is being used on each.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Widget No Longer Displays the Filter Name on It's Header

fields.description:
*Symptoms*:
Zephyr Test Management is missing from the top bar. It is uninstalled since the upgrade

*Cause*
It is suspected that an upgrade today caused Zephyr to not come up properly. 
Reinstalling in UPM does not work and returns the following error:
{{An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information.}}

*Workaround*
Certain instances were fixed by re-subscribing to Zephyr Test Management in _Find new add-on_
fields.summary: Zephyr Test Management not working on JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
There are several managers that persist the group name using the case as is, it is recommended that all manager save the group name using the correct case by calling: 
{code}
IdentifierUtils.toLowerCase(groupName)
{code}
when needed.

This probably needs an upgrade task.

We need to fix all the manager and stores that are doing the wrong thing:
* DefaultCommentManager.java
* DefaultWorklogManager.java

There is likely many more. Any store/manager that persists the group name.

Here is a list of possibilities:
* PermissionSchemeManager
* IssueSecuritySchemeManager
* ProjectRoleManager
* FilterSubscription
* globalPermissionManager
* NotificationSchemeManager

Also look at the stores/managers for the following tables:
* projectroleactor
* membershipbase
* sharepermissions
* groupbase
* jiraaction
* jiraperms (deprecated)
* customfieldvalue

Also investigate project types.
fields.summary: Fix case sensitivity for group names being persisted in Stores
Backup Manager hangs without error messages if the attachments size is too big

fields.description:
Both *Date Time Picker* and *Date Picker* have as their default selected value yesterday and not today.
This behaviour changed recently with the latest JIRA updates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Date time picker custom field.
# Properly assign it to a project (screens and etc)
# Create a new issue (or edit an existing one) under the project where the field is configured.
# Click on the custom field.
# When the calendar pops up, click on "Today"

h3. Expected Results

Field is populated with current date and time.

h3. Actual Results

Field does not populate current time. The date is properly, but time usually remains as 9:00 PM

{code}No log output{code}
 
h3. Notes

This issue also affects Tempo "Log Work" Custom field 

h3.Workaround

Currently there is no workaround other then manually editing the date/time accordingly.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Today" no longer populates current time on "Date Time Picker" and "Date Picker" custom fields.
